Rule.NonCompliantComment: The MongoDB key file permissions are not set correctly, which may expose sensitive keys to unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure appropriate key file permissions are set. Command: 1. Locate the key file using: cat /etc/mongod.conf | grep "keyFile" 2. Set the file permissions with the following commands: chmod 600 /etc/ssl/mongodb-keyfile chown mongodb:mongodb /etc/ssl/mongodb-keyfile 3. Restart the MongoDB service using systemctl restart mongod.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The MongoDB database file permissions are not set correctly, which may expose sensitive data to unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure appropriate database file permissions are set. Command: 1. Locate the database file location using: cat /etc/mongod.conf | grep "dbPath" 2. Set the file permissions with the following commands: chmod 770 /var/lib/mongodb chown mongodb:mongodb /var/lib/mongodb 3. Restart the MongoDB service using systemctl restart mongod.
